The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

arguments.info: List of objects where the rules in this section will be enforced. This will take precedence over rule level appliedTo
Description of this resource
The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set
List of firewall rules in the section. Only homogeneous rules are supported

subblock.info: Action enforced on the packets which matches the firewall rule
List of object where rule will be enforced. The section level field overrides this one. Null will be treated as any
List of the destinations. Null will be treated as any
Rule direction in case of stateless firewall rules. This will only considered if section level parameter is set to stateless. Default to IN_OUT if not specified
Flag to disable rule. Disabled will only be persisted but never provisioned/realized
Defaults to ID if not set
Type of IP packet that should be matched while enforcing the rule (IPV4, IPV6, IPV4_IPV6)
Flag to enable packet logging. Default is disabled
User notes specific to the rule
User level field which will be printed in CLI and packet logs
List of the services. Null will be treated as any
List of sources. Null will be treated as any

arguments.info: Type of the rules which a section can contain. Only homogeneous sections are supported
Stateful or Stateless nature of firewall section is enforced on all rules inside the section
